scenario_text.value: Hmm...

What is it, Shuuji? You look like something’s
bothering you.

I’ve been thinking. I see the others and I
wonder if maybe I’m not a caring person.
Uh, where’s this coming from?

It never even occurred to me to say goodbye
to the Kemonogami. Just what to do next...

And it makes me think maybe something’s wrong
with me.

What? Of course not! Shuuji, you’re working
really hard to help everyone!
Yeah, I think so too.
(Besides, if it weren’t for Shuuji...)
We’d never get going.
We’d have no cohesion.
We’d lack firepower.

...We may never have gotten around to leaving
this place at all.

It’s not that you don’t care. You’re just
focused on what’s best for everyone.

You don’t know how happy it makes me to
hear you say that.

We wouldn’t have anyone who could keep our
group together.

Hmm, I don’t know about that... You and Aoi
are more than up to the task.

That’s not true, I’m telling you! You’ve been
so reliable lately, Shuuji.

Ha ha... Well, I appreciate it, even if it is
just empty flattery.

(I wasn’t trying to flatter him, but I guess
Aoi has taken on the leader role.)

We’d lack the firepower we so desperately
need. Things are tough at the best of times.

Well that’s true. Lopmon and I have to do our
part, seeing how precarious our situation is.
Yeah, let’s do our best!
Right. Together.

What about you, Takuma? Aren’t you going to
say goodbye?

Nah, I’m good. Miu might need some more time,
though.

Yes, she was the queen here for a while,
wasn’t she?

I’ll make sure to get her when it’s time to
go.
Thanks. I’m not sure I could manage it.

I’ll leave that to you, Takuma. You’re
clearly the right one for the job.
Got it!

We have a tough fight ahead of us. We better
prepare the best we can.
